title._content: Elliot Mansion Interior, Main Street, Keene New Hampshire

description._content: TITLE Elliot Mansion Interior, Main Street, Keene New Hampshire CREATOR French, J.A., Keene NH SUBJECT Homes - NH - Keene Houses - NH - Keene DESCRIPTION Photograph of the interior of the Elliot Mansion, 305 Main Street, in Keene New Hampshire, showing the entry hall and staircase. Built in 1811 as a private home by Captain William Wyman, this house was given to the City of Keene in 1892 by John Henry Elliot to be used as a hospital. The 3 large barns were also built in 1811. The property was bought by James Bixby Elliot in 1845 and he lived there with his family for nearly half a century. It became the Elliot Community Hospital. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County DATE DIGITAL 200928 DATE ORIGINAL pre-1892 RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER HS207-P213 RIGHTS MANAGMENT No known copyright restrictions.
